meanings.definition: Squinches (verb): to contort or twist one's body in a tense manner
meanings.sent1: She squinches her face in pain when she stubs her toe.
meanings.sent2: He squinches his eyes shut tightly before jumping into the pool.
meanings.sent3: The clown squinches his nose comically during the silly dance.
meanings.sent4: The gymnast squinches her body like a pretzel during the routine.
meanings.sent5: The cat squinches its body through the narrow gap in the fence.

meanings.definition: Squinches (noun): architectural elements used to transition from a square space to a circular dome
meanings.sent1: The ancient builders used squinches to support the dome above.
meanings.sent2: The architect included intricate squinches in the design of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The squinches in the palace give it a unique and elegant look.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the squinches with gold accents to highlight their beauty.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide explained the purpose of the squinches in the historical building.
